investigators: Boiseau, M.; Ghil, M.; Juillet-Leclerc, A.

author.name: Boiseau, M.; Ghil, M.; Juillet-Leclerc, A

publication.title: Climatic trends and interdecadal variability from South-Central Pacific coral records
publication.citation: Boiseau, M.; Ghil, M.; Juillet-Leclerc, A. 1999. Climatic trends and interdecadal variability from South-Central Pacific coral records. Geophysical Research Letters, 26.
publication.abstract: We study climate variability over interdecadal time scales from d13C and d18O  records, measured in a Porites lutea coral core drilled in the Moorea lagoon.  Previously, we demonstrated that the annual d18O variations reflect those  in sea-surface temperature (SST), while the annual d13C variations record  primarily cloud-cover changes.  We apply two distinct spectral analysis methods  to the d13C and d18O time series from 1853 to 1989. Our analysis of the d18O  record shows a secular warming trend and a 35-year oscillation in temperatures  over the last 137 years. A trend and a 34-year cycle are also found in the  d13C record. The latter trend may be caused by either anthropogenic effects or a cloud-cover increase in this region of the Pacific Ocean, while the  interdecadal oscillation appears to be related to changes in cloud cover,  as well as in precipitation.
